Anton.Action: Snatches the documents and walks away reading them, quickly taking control of the situation.
Corrects Jimmy about his role firmly but fairly, demonstrating knowledge of the crew and their capabilities.
Mentors Jimmy by explaining the continuous nature of orbital work and the importance of vigilance.
Shows slight impatience or dismissiveness when unimpressed with Jimmy's engineer level, indicating confidence but potentially a blunt communication style.
Corrects Jimmy’s address from 'chief' to 'Captain' asserting his rank calmly, showing confidence and clarity.
Delegates multiple tasks brusquely and refuses to sign overtime forms, insists on strict deadlines.
Introduces Jimmy to Tilda and advises him not to talk to her.
Gives orders without explanation, shows little patience or friendliness.
Delegates technical repair tasks with some knowledge of the equipment and insists on deadlines, showing command and direction.
Tells Jimmy to fix the coffee machine without knowing if it requires taking the mainframe offline, showing a possible disregard for technical complexities.
Uses the computer at another terminal confidently, indicating familiarity and capability with the systems.
Dismisses ground control instructions brusquely and denies assistance, asserting authority.
Supports Tilda by rejecting unnecessary sensor check suggestion and instructs her to keep working.
Looks at the monitor and quickly assesses that the cargo drone alarm is too small for a laser sweep, showing situational understanding.
Dismisses ground control's orders and insists on his own assessment, confidently taking control of the situation.
Tells Jimmy not to look at the sensors and to keep working without further investigation, possibly missing an opportunity to gain more information.
Presses keys and radio button decisively to directly address ground control and assert authority.
Refuses to accept that the situation may be a priority one for others and dismisses it as 'not our problem,' which could indicate overconfidence or lack of adaptability.
Immediately calls for Valentina to come to the control room, showing reliance and concern for team protocol.
Dismisses Ground Control's suggestion brusquely and calls them 'morons'.
Responds curtly to Jimmy's question about lunch, prioritizing his own computer issue without friendliness.
Leaps into action at the controls immediately after the alarm sounds, coordinates a salvage operation including directing Valentina and ordering team actions.
Questions if there are salvage crews in the sector and expresses interest in what might be recovered, showing concern for teamwork and resource sharing.
No apparent friendly interaction or expressions of personal warmth toward crew beyond task-focused commands.
Refuses to cut in the new guy on salvage but eventually cedes the better space suit to Valentina despite it being smelly.
Initially insists on not sharing salvage equally and is somewhat dismissive when Valentina protests.
Assertively claims the better space suit first and negotiates with Valentina about suit choice, showing confidence and leadership.
Reluctantly compromises and takes the less desirable, smelly suit without further argument, demonstrating practical problem-solving and adaptability.
Expresses uncertainty about the cargo drone's value but still encourages pursuing it as a potential haul, showing cautious optimism and situational awareness despite incomplete information.
Hands Valentina a sandwich despite initially hesitating and offering a veggie option first.
Turns off the radio to ignore Ground Control's order, prioritizing his own agenda.
Shows camaraderie with Valentina by sharing food and working together on the pod.
Communicates actively with the team to assess the situation, trying to get ground control on the emergency channel.
Pulls up a handle like a parking brake, responding calmly under pressure.
Voice is garbled from holding the microphone too close, causing strain for the crew to hear him.
Asks about communication status with Ground control and confirms unusual events calmly.
Orders a check on the humming noise and demands a report within a set time.
Dismisses Jimmy's break casually, implying authority and control over the situation.
Insists on hourly reports every half hour and demands Jimmy get on the mainframe problem immediately.
Voice is distorted to the edge of incomprehensibility, which may reduce effective communication.
Tries to help Valentina by figuring out what she is doing wrong at the communications station.
Does not acknowledge the tension or the serious situation of being stranded while focusing on technical troubleshooting.
Attempts to troubleshoot communications by pressing buttons at Valentina's station and tries to figure out what she is doing wrong.
Dismisses Valentina's statement about there being nothing out there by insisting it must be a communications problem without further evidence.
Offers reassurance to Valentina, tries to comfort her despite tension.
Dismisses Valentina's desire for reassignment and concerns too quickly, showing lack of emotional insight.
Attempts to rationalize an incident (bad egg sandwiches causing sickness) to explain his behavior.
Fails to understand or address the real issues upsetting Valentina, asking surface questions instead of deeper ones.
Encourages taking breaks and following a schedule during the game.
Responds to questions about food options with practical but blunt answers.
Skeptically questions Jimmy about having a girlfriend, challenging his statements.
Participates in light-hearted scrabble competition and interacts with others without hostility.
Writes down the score correctly and keeps the scrabble game organized.
Attempts to maintain a schedule and enforce taking breaks.
Engages in questioning Jimmy about social interactions in a somewhat skeptical way.
Fails to provide alternatives when asked about food besides sandwiches, showing limited problem solving.
Offers Tilda a sandwich and tries to engage her, despite her ignoring him.
Tells Tilda to stop making noise in an irritated tone.
Encourages Jimmy to sit down and join the game, maintaining the social setting.
Dismisses rushing into snap decisions and seems critical of others.
Looks over Jimmy's shoulder to assess the damage together.
Orders Valentina to meet him in the airlock module right away, showing urgency but no rudeness.
Recognizes orbital position issue quickly and directs Jimmy to the correct console, showing situational awareness and technical understanding.
Analyzes fuzzy screen image and logically deduces that the damage is unlikely from an asteroid, demonstrating critical thinking.
Puts on helmet, suits up and enters the airlock resolutely, showing confidence and readiness to take initiative.
Calls Valentina to meet him in the airlock module urgently, indicating awareness and proactive communication.
Gently helps Valentina remove her helmet and engages her in conversation about the rubber duckies with curiosity and light humor.
Questions Valentina skeptically about denying ownership of one of the rubber duckies, implying distrust.
Successfully completes an EVA, returns with a burned rubber duckie from outside the ship showing observational skills.
Questions Valentina logically about the rubber ducks, comparing markings and pointing out contradictions.
Appears overconfident or slightly confrontational when accusing Valentina of denying ownership without strong evidence.
Practices martial arts with multiple styles in his karate gear, showing dedication and skill development.
Points out to Jimmy that his shift started ten minutes ago, indicating awareness and responsibility.
Responds to Valentina that he hadn't noticed Tilda acting weird, suggesting lack of attention or awareness.
Compliments Jimmy with 'Well done, Jimmy.'
Tells Tilda she is useless and criticizes her attitude, saying 'Am I the only one trying to maintain order on this station? I'm telling you it's lonely at the top.'
Orders Tilda to help Jimmy but allows her to leave, showing some tolerance.
Acknowledges and appreciates Jimmy's successful action ('Well done, Jimmy.')
Issues commands clearly ('Fix it.', 'Help Jimmy.'), attempts to maintain order under stress
Dismisses Tilda as 'useless' and scolds her attitude, possibly undermining teamwork
Expresses frustration and claims loneliness as a leader ('lonely at the top') instead of focusing on collaborative problem solving
Interrupts Jimmy and Tilda to correct their Scrabble game, monitors Jimmy closely, insists on Jimmy earning and properly caring for his jumpsuit, ends conversation with 'And you, shape up.'
Questions Valentina about her rubber duck, shows curiosity about personal sentiment by inspecting the duck with the V+G inscription.
Corrects Jimmy about needing to connect words on the scrabble board and enforces rules about the uniform and caring for it.
Suddenly appears and asserts control without explanation, causing nervousness.
Questions Valentina about the significance of a rubber duck, showing curiosity and attention to detail.
Lightly teases Wendi by calling her 'Walter' and repeating it, trying to get a response.
Dismisses Jimmy's question about the coffee machine with 'How should I know?'.
Directs Jimmy to look in salvage bay for parts and urges him to act immediately.
Notes that the voice was not fixed, indicating attention to detail.
Suggests renaming Wendi to Walter, showing a casual but somewhat arbitrary approach rather than technical focus.
Tells Jimmy to check the salvage bay for parts despite uncertainty about the coffee machine issue, showing problem-solving under uncertainty.
Admits he doesn't know what is wrong with the coffee machine.
Checks files on relationship counseling and crew psychology, showing concern for interpersonal dynamics.
Makes repeated clinical inquiries about Valentina's past relationships and medical history in a blunt, intrusive manner.
Leans close to a screen that scrolls data and comments insightfully on anatomy.
Gets up and sits down without any apparent purposeful action or decision.
Asks about someone’s sense of humor and reputation, seeking contextual information.
Calls Wendi 'completely useless' and 'stupid' after she cannot provide information.
Approaches Tilda, expresses concern about her wellbeing, encourages her to smile and rejoin the team despite the grim situation.
Shows disappointment that Tilda hasn't held it together, emphasizing her role as a trained officer.
Barges into Valentina's room with her bath robe, ignoring her privacy and boundaries.
Dismissively tells Valentina to calm down when she is upset.
Accuses Valentina of exclusion and brings up her personal relationship based on gossip.
Uses information from Wendi to confront Valentina about her private matters.
Tries to calm Valentina down and encourages not to fight, showing concern for relationship peace.
Responds to Valentina's insults calmly and suggests to take a break and join later when she is ready, showing patience and tolerance.
Attempts to de-escalate conflict by proposing to set aside issues and encourages calm conversation.
Responds to Valentina's insults by calmly leaving the room and suggesting she adjust her attitude before talking, showing emotional control and tact.
Pulls out a chair for Valentina when she enters.
Questions Tilda about her statement in a straightforward manner.
Pulls out a chair for Valentina, showing polite social behavior.
Tries again to make a cup of coffee, indicating persistence in a simple task.
Disputes Jimmy's claim that Tilda is a robot without substantial evidence.
Asks 'Since when?' in response to Tilda's claim about the mirror universe, showing curiosity and attempting to clarify information.
Asks Valentina to check out the power fluctuation, encouraging her involvement.
Makes coffee and invites Valentina to the rec room after the false alarm.
Asks clear, relevant questions about the time cube and the power fluctuation, demonstrating awareness.
Delegates inspection of the power issue to Valentina, encouraging involvement and responsibility.
Relies on others to check and resolve problems rather than taking direct action himself.
Pours coffee and offers it to Tilda, showing polite attentiveness.
Asks about the missing crew member with visible concern.
Eats his sandwich while conversing, showing casualness but no direct warmth signal.
Pours coffee and tries to engage Tilda in conversation to gather information about missing crew member and situation.
Eats sandwich while discussing serious matters, showing a casual demeanor possibly indicating calmness or distraction.
Asks direct and relevant questions about missing crew member and situation, showing concern and seeking clarity.
Expresses concern about missing crew member and situation
Uses strong language (expletive) indicating frustration
Conveys confusion and worry about alarm and situation unfolding
Recognizes the significance of Gary Pinback's presence on the station and expresses concern promptly.
Reacts verbally with frustration ('Son of a bitch') indicating emotional response but no immediate action.
Questions what is happening when alarms go off, indicating awareness of situation changes.
No immediate visible action to resolve the situation or lead a response after alarms trigger and Tilda shows distress.
Presses button to turn off sirens and lights promptly, tries to clarify situation by asking questions calmly.
Accuses Valentina and Wendi of hiding information and being secretive, tones imply suspicion and distrust.
Willing to follow Valentina's suggestion to question Tilda, shows cooperation.
Demands Jimmy and Tilda follow orders strictly, shows impatience and harshness.
Presses a button to turn off sirens and lights calmly upon arriving, indicating quick assessment and response.
Asks clarifying questions about Gary's presence to understand the situation clearly.
Shows suspicion and interrogates Valentina and Wendi about the mystery man onboard, attempting to gain control of the situation.
Accepts Valentina's proposal to confront Tilda directly to get answers, showing decisiveness.
Seems unaware or dismissive of the significance of the cube initially, asking 'What's the big deal with this cube?'
Gives instructions over radio to Jimmy to take Tilda to the computer room and fix the control systems, indicating command and problem-solving.
Criticizes Jimmy for not staying put as instructed, showing insistence on discipline and order.
Shows suspicious and distrustful attitude towards Gary, calls him a 'bastard' and questions how he got on the station.
Responds quickly to potential danger and tries to assess the situation (checks air pressure, reacts to Valentina's warning).
Does not notice or engage with the rubber duck in the room, indicating possible lack of attentiveness or openness.
Acknowledges something is wrong and instructs to check air pressure.
Fails to notice Gary (the duck) nearby despite it being in the room with him.
Shows confusion about how Gary got on the station after being informed, indicating lack of awareness.
Speaks gently to the duck, saying 'Hello little guy. Don't be afraid. We mean you no harm.'
Points laser at the duck and prepares to fire shortly after showing initial tenderness.
Expresses surprise and mild respect for the duck's strength after being attacked, saying 'It sure is strong for a little guy.'
Asks Valentina why she didn't just tell him about the duck, showing some frustration but no hostility.
Charges laser blaster and attempts to intimidate an unknown creature
Pulls trigger on laser pistol without checking if it is loaded
Is attacked and knocked down by the creature, loses his weapon
Tries to locate the creature after being attacked, shows alertness
Engages physically with the creature despite initial uncertainty
Allows Valentina to put a band-aid on him without complaint.
Questions Valentina about whose side she is on, showing suspicion.
Prepares to confront an unknown threat, tells Valentina to stay back, tries to protect others.
Screams a war-cry and frightens Jimmy accidentally.
Jokes with Jimmy about how he got a bruise, showing playfulness.
Pulls the handlebar off an exercise machine to use as a club and prepares to confront a potential threat cautiously.
Draws his laser blaster only to find his holster empty, indicating lack of readiness.
Issues a warning to Valentina and attempts to subdue the unknown figure with reasonable force.
Lets out a war-cry that startles Jimmy but is ultimately ineffective at identifying the real threat.
Falsely attributes a facial injury to being attacked by a 'rubber duck,' showing a playful or evasive response under pressure.
Says he will ask nicely to stop destroying the station before resorting to violence
Threatens to kill the culprit 'as hard as I can'
Explores the crew quarters cautiously, using the elliptical machine handle as a club to protect himself while searching shaded areas.
Tells Tilda to get back and gives her the backpack with the Time Cube for safety.
Stomps on the rubber duck aggressively and mistakes which one is the correct duck.
Warns Tilda to stay back and approaches danger cautiously to find Gary.
Confronts Gary angrily and prepares to strike him after accusations and provocations
Engages in a violent fight resulting in blood and destruction on his space station
Confronts an intruder aggressively and prepares to defend his space station and girlfriend by charging into a fight with evident rage and determination.
Engages in a violent fight but ends up badly injured, requiring immediate first aid and blood loss management, indicating possible poor self-preservation or overestimation of his combat ability.
Notices Gary lurking and responds with a threat, tries to sit up but falls down, appears physically weak or incapacitated.
Nods in confirmation when Valentina refuses to be bossed around; supports her defiance.
Grabs a chair to defend himself against Gary.
Is pulled over by his neck by a tentacle and drops the chair, then is thrown down by the hatch.
Catches the Time Cube thrown by Valentina.
Helps Valentina up after the confrontation with Gary, asks where Jimmy is, shows situational awareness.
Appears dazed during the confrontation, does not actively intervene in a threatening situation.
Sits in shock with Valentina but quickly directs her to get the debris, cooperating with the team.
Hugs Valentina after successfully atomizing debris.
Responds warmly to Ground Control: 'Roger that... Nice to hear from you, anytime.'
Sits in shock initially but quickly gives the right command to deal with the debris warning.
Calmly acknowledges Ground Control after successful debris atomization and responds with friendly professionalism.
Refuses to follow Ground Control's suggestion to take a pod out for class two debris, citing protocol.
Asserts authority on the radio, uses direct and confident communication.
Shows irritation and calls others 'morons' after switching off the radio.
Demands his computer be fixed immediately, indicating frustration but also awareness of his needs and priorities.
Probes Valentina about 'Gary' and her emotions, questioning her motives and possessions.
Questions the status of their separation in a somewhat confrontational way when Valentina asserts they are separated.
Engages Valentina in a probing conversation, showing attention to details like names and relationships.
Appears somewhat argumentative or sarcastic when questioning Valentina about their separation.
Does not take decisive action to stop Valentina from leaving or to resolve the situation, showing possible passivity.
Reluctantly accepts Valentina's ham sandwich after she gives it up.
Presses Valentina to tell more about Gary and listens patiently.
Expresses clear intent to kill Gary after Gary tried to bite him.
Sides quickly with Tilda against Valentina's plea to help Gary, showing distrust.
Is seriously injured but allows Tilda to perform urgent medical treatment without showing panic or interference.
Shows concern for Valentina, notices something is wrong, attempts to confront Gary to protect her.
Struggles physically and relies on Valentina's help to settle down.
Nods in confirmation of Valentina's defiance against being bossed around.
Looks pitiful and intimidated, still weak from injuries.
